tweets.text: The community the live near Bois Mill on the @RiverChess tell us not only highly discoloured but smell was terrible, the worst they remember. The @EnvAgency need to note this has nothing to do with storm events, no rain yesterday, this is entirely due to groundwater ingress. https://t.co/zPThbWUdBw

Timely! Environment Agency chair thinks it's time big polluters were fined a proportion of their turnover, rather the existing "disproportionately small" penalties, which "don't act as a deterrent". 
https://t.co/nYRG6eioeZ
This is a big part of Britain’s litter problem.  Chronic lack of enforcement of laws by @EnvAgency and @HighwaysEngland @BBCJustinR https://t.co/Qv6ISawY9f

Can you help us in our fight against #WasteCrime? 

We've launched a Waste Crime Survey to help us build a better intelligence picture across the country. 

Your responses will be kept confidential and anonymous. 

Complete the survey here: https://t.co/THxMyWjzgX https://t.co/2s6TGQONnn

.@thameswater fined £2.3m for polluting an #Oxfordshire stream with sewage that killed more than 1,110 fish from 13 different species.

READ the whole story of management failings and broken equipment ⬇️.

Please call us if you suspect river #pollution: 0800 807060
#environment https://t.co/goOwgTCgMS

We have some repair tests lined up for tomorrow. We will repair 2 damages, 1 with rock bags and 1 with a clay solution. We can't wait!
#climateadaptation #floodprotection #emergencyrepair #research Thx @Rijkswaterstaat @EnvAgency @STOWAwater @Defensie @Vlaamsewaterweg @waterschap https://t.co/r15XtPVZsQ

You have until Fri 5th to complete their survey here: https://t.co/oOhvZRE5C9 https://t.co/erJN9QfzCs

Out flying the drone looking at a restoration site completed a couple of years ago and a pond/wetland completed a few days ago... just waiting for it to green up a bit to plant some wetland plants & trees #pond #riverrestoration funded through DEFRA NFM @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/wgFQsTtEBI

Beautiful day for a drone flyover at Smardale where last year we planted 800 trees in the floodplain for a Natural Flood Management (#NFM) project. Thanks to funding from @EnvAgencyNW and @westmorlanddale https://t.co/bpNx2xawfY
